business.headline: May consider dividends to citizens: Trump on tariff revenue disbursal plansTrump has signed a new executive order that imposes fresh import tariffs on goods from 69 countries and the European Union, which will come into effect on August 7.

Loan fraud case: ED issues lookout notice against Anil AmbaniA lookout circular has been issued against Anil Ambani at the request of the Enforcement Directorate (ED), preventing him from travelling abroad without court permission.

Anil Ambani faces lookout notice in Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud caseAnil Ambani can now no longer travel outside India without court permission. This comes after a series of crackdowns on his business entities, allegations of fraud against his firms, and a summons issued by a federal agency.
Vandana Vasudevan on how tech is reshaping daily lifeSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan explains how this shift is changing daily routines.

OTP Please! The double-edged sword of digital living: Vandana VasudevanSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan tells how tech has changed how we live, making travel easier for the disabled, food more accessible, and work more flexible. But she warns of fading community bonds, unhealthy habits, and insecure gig jobs. Tech must support life, not replace human connection.

US tariffs will not have significant adverse impact on Indian economy: SourcesThe 25% tariff announced by US President Donald Trump will not have a significant adverse impact on the Indian economy, government sources said.

Elon Musk's Starlink to operate soon in India. Check monthly plansUnion Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia confirmed that Starlink has been awarded a Unified Licence to launch its satellite internet operations in India.
Sensex closes 586 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Infosys ends 3% downThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 585.67 points to close at 80,599.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 203 points to end at 24,565.35.

CA explains why you should not use FDs as an emergency fundAccording to RBI guidelines, banks can charge up to 0.5% to 1.0% of the interest rate as a penalty if FDs are broken before their maturity period.

Indian interests top priority, no chance of compromising due to US tariffs: SourcesAn official said that the government is closely watching the developments but sees no reason for alarm after the US imposed a 25% tariff on India.

Jane Street not cooperating in probe with income tax department: ReportThe firm's servers are located outside India, and officials said they are unable to access them. Additionally, accounts books are also being maintained overseas, even though company law requires them to be kept in India.

Planning to buy a car without taking loan? Here's how you can do itThink you need a big salary or bank loan to own a car? Think again. A thoughtful plan, regular savings, and side gigs helped one man save Rs 7.1 lakh in three years, all without borrowing a rupee. Here's how you can do it too.

entertainment.headline: Kingdom box office Day 2: Major drop for Vijay Deverakonda's spy film on FridayVijay Deverakonda's 'Kingdom' saw a big drop in its collection on the second day at the box office. The film is expected to pick up the pace on Saturday and Sunday, after already emerging as the biggest opener of the actor's career.

Saiyaara box office Day 15: Ahaan Panday's film remains unbothered by new releases'Saiyaara' didn't seem to be affected by 'Son of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2' at the box office. The film will be entering the Rs 300 crore club by the end of its third weekend in India.

Son of Sardaar 2 vs Dhadak 2 box office Day 1: Ajay Devgn's film earns twiceBoth 'Son of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2' have received mixed reviews from the audience and critics. The films also faced 'Saiyaara', opening to a single-digit figure at the box office.

Malayalam actor Kalabhavan Nawas found dead at Kochi hotelActor Kalabhavan Nawas had reportedly gone to his hotel room to bring his luggage while checking out. However, the hotel staff found him dead in the room when they went up to check on him.

Flaco Jimenez, accordion king who made Tejano global, dies at 86Flaco Jimenez, Grammy-winning accordionist, brought global recognition to Tejano and conjunto music through his genre-blending style and iconic

Spider-Man: Brand New Day teaser released as Tom Holland swings back into actionTom Holland returns in Spider-Man: Brand New Day. Sony teases a new suit, real-world filming in Glasgow, and direction by Shang-Chi's Destin Daniel Cretton.

Overwhelmed SRK calls National Award responsibility to show truth, not finishing lineActor Shah Rukh Khan wrote a heartfelt note on winning the Best Actor in a Leading Role Award for 'Jawan' at the 71st National Film Awards. He shared the award with actor Vikrant Massey.

Kim Kardashian reacts to Anthony Hopkins Hanibal spoof of her face wrap brandActor Anthony Hopkins humorously wore a SKIMS face wrap resembling his Hannibal Lecter mask. He joked about feeling younger in the viral video.

Shilpa Rao thanks Shah Rukh Khan, Anirudh as she wins National Award for ChaleyaSinger Shilpa Rao thanked actor Shah Rukh Khan after winning the Best Playback Singer Award at the 71st National Award. She won the award for the romantic track - 'Chaleya' from 'Jawan'.

Janki Bodiwala dedicates National Award to team Vash, calls director her godJanki Bodiwala won the Best Supporting Actor award at the 71st National Film Awards for her impactful role in the Gujarati film 'Vash', marking a major milestone in her career. She shared the honour with Malayalam actor Urvashi and hopes this win will inspire more female-led stories in regional cinema.

Vikrant Massey dedicates National Award to marginalised, lucky sharing it with SRKVikrant Massey has won his first National Award for his powerful role in the film '12th Fail'. He expressed heartfelt gratitude and dedicated the honour to marginalised people.

The Kerala Story's Sudipto Sen reacts to Best Director win at National AwardsSudipto Sen won the Best Director for 'The Kerala Story' at the 71st National Film Awards. The film's portrayal of ISIS recruitment sparked debate but gained widespread public support.

Rajinikanth's Coolie gets A certificate ahead of August 14 releaseRajinikanth's upcoming film 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, earned an A certificate. Featuring a stellar cast and Aamir Khan's special cameo, the film is highly anticipated for its high-octane sequences and will release on August 14 in multiple languages.

Rani Mukerji calls her first National Award as Best Actress deeply personalRani Mukerji won her first National Award for 'Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway' after 30 years in films. She dedicated the award to all mothers and thanked her fans for their love and support.

Tehran trailer: John Abraham battles enemies across borders in action-packed dramaJohn Abraham's upcoming film 'Tehran' is a gripping spy thriller inspired by real events, with a trailer that teases intense action, political drama, and a high-stakes mission. The film, co-starring Manushi Chhillar, will premiere on Zee5 on August 14.

71st National Film Awards: Best Actor, Best Film and more. Full winners' list hereThe 71st National Film Awards were announced in New Delhi, honouring excellence across Indian cinema with Shah Rukh Khan and Vikrant Massey sharing Best Actor and Rani Mukerji winning Best Actress. Check out the full winners' list here.

Vikrant Massey-SRK share National Award for Best Actor, Rani Mukerji wins Best ActressVikrant Massey and Shah Rukh Khan won Best Actor for '12th Fail' and 'Jawan' respectively at the 71st National Film Awards. Rani Mukerji bagged Best Actress for her role in 'Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway'.

Sanya Malhotra's Kathal wins Best Hindi Feature at National Film Awards 2025'Kathal: A Jackfruit Mystery' won Best Hindi Feature at the 71st National Film Awards, announced on August 1. The film was praised for its unique storytelling, strong performances, and socially relevant message.

Janhvi Kapoor-Ishaan Khatter's Homebound to close Indian Film Festival of MelbourneAfter a successful premiere at Cannes, 'Homebound' starring Ishaan Khatter, Vishal Jethwa, and Janhvi Kapoor will close the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne (IFFM) 2025. Directed by Neeraj Ghaywan, the film explores friendship, ambition, and the emotional cost of change.

general news.headline: Have no reports of Indian oil firms halting Russian imports: Government sourcesGovernment sources dismissed the reports of Indian firms stopping Russian oil imports, asserting that India's energy decisions are based on market dynamics and national interest.

Good step: Trump welcomes reports of India possibly halting Russian oil importsThe US has exerted geopolitical pressure on countries continuing to purchase Russian oil, as part of its intensified efforts to curb Moscow's revenue streams amid the ongoing war in Ukraine.

Enough nuke submarines to control two: Russian lawmaker after Trump's moveRussia dismisses Trump's submarine move, claiming US subs are already tracked. Moscow urges calm as tensions rise amid fears of direct conflict.

Supper clubs are having a moment, and it's not just about the foodSupper clubs, a rising trend in the food scene, are all about turning strangers into dinner companions over delicious food and laid-back conversations. There's something special about sharing a table, discovering new flavours, and chatting without pressure; it brings people together in the most effortless way.

No Jassi bhai, no problem: Workhorse Siraj steps up for India againENG vs IND, 5th Test: India looked adrift on a gloomy day at The Oval. No Bumrah, no early breakthroughs, no rhythm. Ben Duckett and Zak Crawley were tearing into an attack that seemed toothless. But then, Mohammed Siraj stepped in. The man who's quietly carried India's pace load this series stepped up and swung the momentum in India's favour.

Operation Akhal: Terrorist killed in gunfight with security forces in J&KOne TRF terrorist was killed, and two others are trapped in an ongoing gunfight with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district. The encounter is part of Operation Akhal following inputs about terrorists linked to the Pahalgam attack.

Luxury flats, prime properties: Vigilance raid uncovers Odisha engineer's empireA raid on a Bhubaneswar engineer led to the discovery of two four-storey buildings, seven flats, four commercial properties and nine high-value plots in and around the city.

Is Raj Thackeray's stagecraft with MVA another prep for Maharashtra's political reset?After the show of strength with Uddhav Thackeray, the MNS chief is set to join forces with key leaders of the Opposition bloc at the PWP's foundation day rally on August 2

Story of the crash of Flight AI 171 and a very flighty investigative reportThe Boeing 787 Dreamliner, which was on its way to London, crashed into the BJ Medical College hostel building in Ahmedabad within minutes of take-off on June 12. The tragedy left 260 people dead. Within a month of the AAIB's preliminary investigation report on the crash appearing to have settled blame on the cockpit crew, a veteran pilot shattered the silence with a striking analysis that turned the investigation on its head.
Flipkart Freedom Sale: Tablets Get Their Biggest Price Drop of the YearFor buyers looking to invest in a new device, this could be the best chance before the festive season arrives.

Caught on camera: Man slaps fellow passenger having panic attack on IndiGo flightIn the video, the man was seen slapping the passenger unprovoked. The man having a panic attack was being helped by air hostesses when he was suddenly slapped by the accused.

Malayalam actor Kalabhavan Nawas found dead at Kochi hotelActor Kalabhavan Nawas had reportedly gone to his hotel room to bring his luggage while checking out. However, the hotel staff found him dead in the room when they went up to check on him.

71st National Film Awards: Best Actor, Best Film and more. Full winners' list hereThe 71st National Film Awards were announced in New Delhi, honouring excellence across Indian cinema with Shah Rukh Khan and Vikrant Massey sharing Best Actor and Rani Mukerji winning Best Actress. Check out the full winners' list here.

Forced to name Yogi Adityanath, RSS leaders in Malegaon case: Hostile witnessMilind Joshirao alleged that he was subjected to custodial torture and pressured to implicate RSS leaders and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath.

What India said on White House's call for Nobel Peace Prize for TrumpWhite House has claimed that the global peace deals brokered by Trump average to one per month and has reiterated the call for the Nobel Peace Prize to be awarded to the US President.

SpaceX launches Crew-11 astronauts on six-month mission to spaceThe Crew-11 mission ferried four astronauts to the International Space Station (ISS) for a science and technology expedition. The crew includes Nasa astronauts Zena Cardman and Mike Fincke, Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) astronaut Kimiya Yui, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Oleg Platonov.

'Sink city' Gurugram: Who is responsible for Millennium City's civic mess?This India Today special campaign for change focusses on the civic collapse in Gurgaon, the Millennium City. Residents, who have invested significantly in luxury properties, find themselves navigating a city plagued by infrastructural failure, especially during monsoons.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!
Nagpur's 'looteri dulhan' arrested for marrying 8 men, extorting lakhs of rupeesPolice said Samira Fatima used social media websites to identify her victims and lure them for marriage.

Trump sends nuclear submarines near Russia after Putin aide's 'dead hand' threatUS President Trump announced on social media that two nuclear submarines have been deployed near Russia in response to foolish and inflammatory statements by Dimitry Medvedev.

Shaadi without strings, and Gen Z is grabbing the chance to partyThe events mimic real marriages in decorations, rituals, baraat, mehendi and even sangeet, but there's no legal or religious binding—only pure fun

Anil Ambani faces lookout notice in Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud caseAnil Ambani can now no longer travel outside India without court permission. This comes after a series of crackdowns on his business entities, allegations of fraud against his firms, and a summons issued by a federal agency.

Chhattisgarh principal arrested for assaulting student over 'Radhe Radhe' greetingA 3.5-year-old girl was allegedly subjected to physical punishment by the principal of a private school for greeting her with "Radhe-Radhe".

Congress flags 'CISF takeover' of Rajya Sabha, government sources call them marshalsGovernment sources dismissed the claims, clarifying that the personnel present inside the Rajya Sabha were not part of any new or external security operation but were existing marshals drawn from the CISF, assigned to manage proceedings in the House.

The film is expected to pick up the pace on Saturday and Sunday, after already emerging as the biggest opener of the actor's career.

Malayalam actor Kalabhavan Nawas found dead at Kochi hotelActor Kalabhavan Nawas had reportedly gone to his hotel room to bring his luggage while checking out. However, the hotel staff found him dead in the room when they went up to check on him.

sports.headline: Can India win Oval Test after conceding lead? Here's what history saysENG vs IND, 5th Test: India have won two Test matches at the Kennington Oval and have a chance to add to that tally in the ongoing series, where they are aiming to save the series.

ENG vs IND, Oval Test Day 3 weather report: Will rain halt India's momentum?The Oval Test is in the balance at the moment after an exciting two days of play which did have its fair share of issues with rain interruptions. Will the weather affect the day's play on Saturday, August 2 to halt India's momentum?

Didn't expect that reaction: Prasidh on fiery moment with good mate RootPrasidh Krishna said that he wasn't expecting a big reaction from Joe Root after their verbal spat on Day 2 of the Oval Test on Friday, August 1. Prasidh and Root had a war of words as the umpires had to intervene to solve the matter.

Son Heung-Min announces decision to leave Tottenham: Need a new environmentSon Heung-Min has announced his decision to leave Tottenham Hotspur this summer ahead of the start of the new Premier League campaign. Son is a legend at the club, having joined them in 2015.

Root vs Krishna: England batting coach plays down heated exchangeENG vs IND: England batting coach Marcus Trescothick opened up on the verbal volleys between Joe Root and Prasidh Krishna on Day 2 of the fifth Test at the Kennington Oval in London. Trescothick also commented on the interesting send-off that Akash Deep gave to Ben Duckett.

How clumsy India fought back after poor start with ball? Prasidh Krishna revealsIndia fast bowler Prasidh Krishna revealed how they scripted a comeback in the second session on Day 2 of the fifth Test against England at the Oval after an aggressive opening stand between Ben Duckett and Zak Crawley.

No Jassi bhai, no problem: Workhorse Siraj steps up for India againENG vs IND, 5th Test: India looked adrift on a gloomy day at The Oval. No Bumrah, no early breakthroughs, no rhythm. Ben Duckett and Zak Crawley were tearing into an attack that seemed toothless. But then, Mohammed Siraj stepped in. The man who's quietly carried India's pace load this series stepped up and swung the momentum in India's favour.

Lion-hearted Siraj, brave Jaiswal inspire Indian fightback in spicy Oval TestIndia vs England, 5th Test: Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna's efforts with the ball and Yashasvi Jaiswal's brisk second-innings fifty helped India overcome a poor morning session and edge ahead in a thrilling Test at Oval in London.

Want us to keep quiet? Watch KL Rahul argue with umpire to back Prasidh vs RootIndia vs England: Day 2 of the final Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy Test saw intense sledging between Indian fast bowlers and England players. KL Rahul argued with umpire Kumar Dharmasena, who was seen warning Prasidh Krishna for a verbal duel with Joe Root.

Pakistan, Afghanistan, UAE to play T20I tri-series to prepare for Asia CupPakistan, Afghanistan, and the UAE will play a T20I tri-series in Sharjah from August 29 to September 7, 2025. Each team plays the others twice in a double round-robin, with the top two meeting in the final on September.

Siraj earns praise for fiery Oval spell: His heart is bigger than anyone else'sEngland vs India, 5th Test: Mohammed Siraj delivered a fiery bowling spell to lead India's comeback in the final Test at The Oval. Siraj bowled eight overs in a gritty post-lunch session on Day 2 in London.

Ben Duckett and Zak Crawley were tearing into an attack that seemed toothless. But then, Mohammed Siraj stepped in. The man who's quietly carried India's pace load this series stepped up and swung the momentum in India's favour.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
